jobDescription: CrowdStrike is a global leader in cybersecurity. Our University Program is dedicated to attracting and cultivating the next generation of talent in virtually every field. Our program offers paid positions that allow students and recent graduates to gain real-world experience and develop essential skills while they learn from the best and brightest working professionals. We offer our interns a structured program and supportive environment where they can ignite their passion for the future. Our University Program is designed to provide participants exposure to meaningful work that supports our mission to make the digital world a safer place to live and work. CrowdStrike is where your talent meets cutting-edge tech. Ready to start building a career you can be proud of? Join us! Start Date: June 5, 2023 End Date: August 25, 2023 About The Role The CrowdStrike Professional Services CrowdScout Internship is a new, dynamic program geared towards providing undergraduate interns with a wide range of experiences over a variety of different departments within Professional Services. This internship takes place over a twelve-week period during the summer before one’s second to last year of university (rising Juniors in the US, completed 2nd of 4 years in Canada, or approaching the penultimate year in the UK). This program is separate to our team-specific Professional Services internships that are available to students due to enter their final year of university. You Will Be Able To Work In Teams Including The CrowdScout program provides interns the opportunity to cycle between areas in Professional Services. Incident Response (IR) - Our acclaimed IR team responds to some of the most high profile and complex breaches. You will learn how CrowdStrike supports its customers with cyber attacks spanning both ransomware and nation state-sponsored Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) actors. Red Team - Our Red Team is among the best in the world, composed of a team of hackers who support our customers every day in identifying weaknesses in technology and security teams. Their job is to help our clients to prepare a real attack, by using the exact same tactics, techniques & procedures (TTPs) as some of the most sophisticated adversaries. Strategic Advisory - Our Strategic Advisory team supports customers by teaching them how to respond to real cyber threats. Members of this team are technologists who not only understand the complexities of securing the modern workplace, but have the ability to communicate this to technical and non-technical audiences, including legal representation, public relations teams, and CEOs. Technical Operations (TechOps) - Our Professional Services TechOps team is the backbone of everything we do. They provide our Consultants with high performance tools to do our very best work. Half of TechOps are infrastructure engineers who are experts in ensuring that our incident responders can perform forensic analysis quickly and accurately, all in the Cloud, and the other half are software engineers who produce industry-leading tools used both within Services, and also made available to our Falcon Platform customers. Endpoint Recovery Services (ERS) - Our ERS team provides a combination of CrowdStrike's industry leading technology platform (Falcon), threat intelligence and battle-hardened security experts to assist customers with the detection, analysis, and remediation of known security incidents and enable rapid recovery with zero business interruption. They hunt down and eliminate the bad guys while keeping our customers in business Platform Operations Services (POPS) - Our Platform Ops team are a team of Falcon and software deployment experts who support our customers in deploying the Falcon Platform, pushing our Falcon Forensics Collector (FFC) tool to client networks and diagnosing technical issues with our customers’ IT teams to ensure that we can protect them as quickly and as efficiently as possible. They also build out specific solutions for customers who need to quickly move data into/out of Falcon, leverage Falcon for their IR process, or integrate Falcon with another service. This team also maintains its own set of tools, and leverages scripting and programming knowledge to ensure that they are as efficient as possible. This rotational system is designed to provide background into what CrowdStrike and its Professional Services teams do. Successful interns will be invited back for a second summer at CrowdStrike, and will be placed within a Professional Service department more in line with their specific interests. They will be entrusted with higher level projects while building deeper relationships within their team. Successful completion of this internship program can lead to a full-time offer beginning after one’s graduation from university. Therefore, CrowdStrike is searching for forward-thinkers geared towards a future in cybersecurity. We are focused on individuals interested in computer science, cybersecurity, technical buildout and other similar roles; however, you do not need to be majoring in these areas or have any formal training to apply. We are looking to bring in interns who are passionate, curious, and demonstrate the ability and desire to learn and grow. We also understand that there will be a large learning curve and are excited to help you navigate the challenging but incredibly interesting field that is cybersecurity. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve. We encourage all prospective candidates to apply if their background matches the expertise below. What You'll Need CrowdStrike is seeking undergraduate students looking to pursue a career in the cybersecurity industry. An ideal candidate will be the following: Due to enter their penultimate year of a full degree program. Example degree structures include: Four-year Bachelor's program in the United States, Canada or Scotland, expecting to enter the first (rotational) internship after their second year of study Three-year Bachelor’s program in the rest of the United Kingdom, expecting to enter the first (rotational) internship program after their first year of study; or Four-year integrated Master’s program in the rest of the United Kingdom, expecting to enter the first (rotational) program after their second year of study. Genuinely considering the world of cybersecurity as a potential future career Versed in the context to cybersecurity, perhaps through solo research, university education, or work experience. Note that no prior experience is required, but candidates should be able to demonstrate evidence of interest in the field. Interested in a career that involves frequent communication with internal colleagues and external customers on a daily basis. CrowdStrike serves as a trusted advisor to thousands of customers globally, and you should therefore understand what it means to be a Consultant, or an Engineer within a Consulting business What You Can Expect Executive Speaker Series & Tech Talks Fun socials and give-back events (e.g. virtual trivia, escape rooms, etc.) Development workshops to grow your soft and hard skills Networking opportunities with fellow interns and CrowdStrikers Owning impactful projects that move the company forward Working alongside a diverse and global team Assigned mentor and continuous feedback Participation in our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) Access to our FalconFit Wellness Program and Employee Assistance Program Fun Slack channels (e.g. food, gaming, sports, pets, etc.) Paid holidays and 401k matching Remote-first culture Market leader in compensation We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, v

At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. Because of that we’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and talent. Our culture was purpose-built to be remote first, and we offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. If you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology with a team that makes a difference every day, let’s talk. About The Role CrowdStrike is seeking Account Managers to be part of a team responsible for ensuring that our customers are successful and thriving with our next generation endpoint technology. You will proactively advocate for the customer -- focusing on high levels of adoption to ensure the highest degree of customer satisfaction. You have responsibility for ensuring timely renewals as well as upselling and cross-selling within your accounts. You will develop yourself as a trusted advisor that fosters champions to identify security initiatives that map to our solution set and roadmap. The ideal candidate will have a strong track record of success, consultative selling approach, and hail from a SaaS or security company. You will need to be a great listener, strong communicator, as well as a curious and creative problem solver. This role is 100% remote, however we are seeking talent in the following cities: Austin TX, Dallas, TX, Houston, TX, Sunnyvale CA, San Francisco CA, Los Angeles CA, Orange County CA, San Diego CA, Denver, CO, Phoenix AZ and Boston, MA. Would you be open to relocating to any of these cities? Responsibilities Serve as the primary point of contact for clients while collaborating with Sales, Customer Success, and Product to ensure the existing customer base is receiving the value they expect from their implemented solutions. Manage the contract renewal cycle from scheduling initial meetings through negotiation, contract changes, and signature while ensuring customers renew at an escalated ARR rate. Achieve a quota of new sales growth within customer base. Be a customer advocate, driving relationships with key customers and creating new champions. Identify whitespace in accounts and create value based presentations to promote upgrades and cross-sells. Consult with our existing customers to recommend additional solutions from the CrowdStrike portfolio. Devise and execute account strategies and plans to maximize account growth. Provide high touch customer service, including escalation and coordination of support issues as needed. Deliver feedback to the Product Management team on new feature requests and product enhancements from your customer base. Required Skills And Experience Track record of meeting or exceeding expectations in an individually focused, quota carrying role. Ability to successfully balance a wide variety of daily tasks and adjust priorities on the fly in a fast-paced environment over multiple engagements. Technical aptitude and ability to learn new concepts quickly. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills demonstrated through email, conference calls, client visits and presentations, and internal meetings Must be a self-starter with the ability to work independently or in a team environment A curious nature with a desire to learn and a competitive spirit. High level of comfort handling client objections and negotiations. Excellent time management skills. Desired Skills And Experience Security or SaaS sales experience Customer Success/Service background Formal training in a recognized sales methodology Prior experience using Salesforce or another CRM solution Requirements 3+ years or equivalent experience in consulting, account management, or cybersecurity sales Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university or relevant experience. Prior experience selling into city/state governments, higher education, and school districts We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives that encourage new ways of solving problems, so we strive to attract and develop talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels seen, heard and empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight. About The Role CrowdStrike is looking for highly motivated, self-driven, technical analysts dedicated to making a difference in global security by protecting organizations against the most advanced attackers in the world. Our CrowdStrike virtual security operations center offers opportunities to expand your skill set through a wide variety of experiences, detecting and responding to incidents as they occur in real-time for our customers. This position is open to candidates in Austin, TX, San Antonio, TX, St Louis, TX, Arlington, VA and Kirkland, WA. Am I an Analyst, Endpoint Protection Team Candidate? Do you find yourself interested in putting your hands-on technical skills to the test in detecting, containing, and remediating incidents? Are you self-motivated and looking for an opportunity to rapidly accelerate your skills? Do you crave new and innovative work that actually matters to your customer? Do you have an Incident Response or Information Security background that you’re not fully utilizing? Are you capable of leading teams and interacting well with customers? Do you love working around like-minded, smart people who you can learn from and mentor on a daily basis? What You'll Do Exercise incident handling processes across Windows, Mac, and Linux platforms. Perform basic malware analysis. Develop and improve processes for incident detection and the execution of countermeasures Produce high-quality written and verbal communications, recommendations, and findings to customer management. Demonstrate industry thought leadership through blog posts, CrowdCasts, and other public speaking events. What You'll Need Successful candidates will have experience in one or more of the following areas: Incident Handling: experience conducting or managing incident response for organizations, investigating targeted threats such as the Advanced Persistent Threat, Organized Crime, and Hactivists. Computer Forensic Analysis: a background using a variety of forensic analysis tools in incident response investigations to determine the extent and scope of compromise. Systems Administration: an understanding of system internals is required to understand how to implement and execute countermeasures and remediation. Network Forensic Analysis: knowledge of network protocols, network analysis tools, and ability to perform analysis of associated network logs. Malware Analysis: ability to perform static and dynamic malware analysis to understand the nature of malware Incident Remediation: strong understanding of targeted attacks and able to create customized tactical and strategic remediation plans for compromised organizations. Network Operations and Architecture/Engineering: strong understanding of secure network architecture and strong background in performing network operations. Programming/Scripting: experience coding in C, C#, VB, Python, Perl, Ruby on Rails, and .NET. Additionally, All Candidates Must Possess The Following Qualifications Capable of completing technical tasks without supervision. Desire to grow and expand both technical and soft skills. Strong project management skills. Contributing thought leader within the incident response industry. Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude. Requirements Must be willing to work 4x10 schedule, including a day on the weekend. Must be willing to work on site. Offering a hybrid model which allows for some remote days each week after training. This role is only open to US citizens and Green Card holders. Education BA or BS / MA or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Information Security, Information Assurance, Information Security Management, Intelligence Studies, Cybersecurity, Cybersecurity Policy, or a related field. Applicants without a degree but with relevant work experience and/or training will be considered. This role may require the candidate to periodically undergo and pass alcohol and/or drug test(s) during the course of employment. Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike Remote-first culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits Physical and mental wellness programs Paid parental leave, including adoption A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve. CrowdStrike is committed to maintaining an environment of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action. If you need reasonable accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Recruiting@crowdstrike.com , for further assistance. CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program. Notice of E-Verify Participation Right to Work

Are you self-motivated and looking for an opportunity to rapidly accelerate your skills? Do you crave new and innovative work that actually matters to your customer? Do you have an Incident Response or Information Security background that you’re not fully utilizing? Are you capable of leading teams and interacting well with customers? Do you love working around like-minded, smart people who you can learn from and mentor on a daily basis? What You'll Do Exercise incident handling processes across Windows, Mac, and Linux platforms. Perform basic malware analysis. Develop and improve processes for incident detection and the execution of countermeasures Produce high-quality written and verbal communications, recommendations, and findings to customer management. Demonstrate industry thought leadership through blog posts, CrowdCasts, and other public speaking events. What You'll Need Successful candidates will have experience in one or more of the following areas: Incident Handling: experience conducting or managing incident response for organizations, investigating targeted threats such as the Advanced Persistent Threat, Organized Crime, and Hactivists. Computer Forensic Analysis: a background using a variety of forensic analysis tools in incident response investigations to determine the extent and scope of compromise. Systems Administration: an understanding of system internals is required to understand how to implement and execute countermeasures and remediation. Network Forensic Analysis: knowledge of network protocols, network analysis tools, and ability to perform analysis of associated network logs. Malware Analysis: ability to perform static and dynamic malware analysis to understand the nature of malware Incident Remediation: strong understanding of targeted attacks and able to create customized tactical and strategic remediation plans for compromised organizations. Network Operations and Architecture/Engineering: strong understanding of secure network architecture and strong background in performing network operations. Programming/Scripting: experience coding in C, C#, VB, Python, Perl, Ruby on Rails, and .NET. Additionally, All Candidates Must Possess The Following Qualifications Capable of completing technical tasks without supervision. Desire to grow and expand both technical and soft skills. Strong project management skills. Contributing thought leader within the incident response industry. Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude. Requirements Must be willing to work 4x10 schedule, including a day on the weekend. Must be willing to work on site. Offering a hybrid model which allows for some remote days each week after training. This role is only open to US citizens and Green Card holders. Education BA or BS / MA or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Information Security, Information Assurance, Information Security Management, Intelligence Studies, Cybersecurity, Cybersecurity Policy, or a related field. Applicants without a degree but with relevant work experience and/or training will be considered. This role may require the candidate to periodically undergo and pass alcohol and/or drug test(s) during the course of employment. Do you crave new and innovative work that actually matters to your customer? Do you love working around like-minded people in a world class team who you can learn from and mentor on a daily basis? Malware Analysis: Familiar with the concept of static malware analysis. Incident Remediation: Basic understanding of targeted attacks and remediation / mitigation solutions. Programming/Scripting: Experience in coding. About CrowdStrike At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our state of the art technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral based detection allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people – clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let’s talk. About the Role We are growing and we are seeking a Software Engineering Manager for our Discover Cloud Product team in the US. This is an Engineering Manager role that is responsible for owning and delivering product features for our Discover product. for CrowdStrike from concept to release and support. You will help drive and deliver on the technical strategy and roadmap and will be responsible for mentoring the team. CrowdStrike is growing rapidly and you will be instrumental in the hiring, retaining and growth of our world class engineers. You will work cross functionally with your peers in the engineering organization as well as leaders in sales and product. Your impact is not bounded and you will be enabled to engage and collaborate with various teams and ensure your product’s success. We are a remote first company so you must bring your excellent verbal and written communication skills to bear when you are working with your engineering teams and cross functional teams across the globe. You need to have hands-on experience in building cloud solutions. You will work closely with product management to understand the customer requirements and contribute to the delivery roadmap for the product. We are a remote-first company so you must bring your excellent verbal and written communication skills to bear when you are working with your engineering teams and cross-functional teams across the globe. CrowdStrike is a cloud driven company. We love Cassandra, ElasticSearch and Kafka. We are leveraging Golang as our native language. You will need: Demonstrated track record of building and leading a high performing core engineering team 10+ years of software engineering experience in all phases of a software development lifecycle 3+ years of hands-on management experience leading engineering teams A solid grounding in the technology of at least one cloud environment (AWS, Azure, GCP) Broad grounding in all aspects of distributed systems development: understanding of distributed systems concepts and API development Solid design and problem-solving skills with a demonstrated passion for engineering excellence, quality, security, and performance MS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience Bonus Points Exposure to/experience with cybersecurity and intelligence is a plus but not necessary Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike: Remote-first culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits Physical and mental wellness programs Paid parental leave, including adoption A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve. CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight. About The Role CrowdStrike is looking for highly motivated, self-driven, technical cloud security consultants dedicated to making a difference in global security by protecting organizations against the most advanced attackers in the world. Our CrowdStrike Professional Services team offers opportunities to expand your skill set through a wide variety of impactful consulting engagements for many of the world's leading organizations. The Cloud Technical Assessment Senior Consultant would be responsible for identifying and assessing technical risks, while providing meaningful and prioritized recommendations to enhance the security posture of customer cloud environments. This role is only open to candidates based in the US or Canada. Am I a Cloud Technical Assessments candidate? Do you find yourself interested in and keeping up with the latest Azure, M365, AWS, and GCP feature announcements, as well as vulnerabilities and breaches? Are you self-motivated and looking for an opportunity to rapidly accelerate your skills? Do you crave new and innovative work that actually matters to your customer? Do you have a technical Information Security background that you’re not fully utilizing? Are you capable of operating as an individual contributor and occasionally leading teams and interacting with customers? Do you love working around like-minded, smart people who you can learn from and mentor on a daily basis? What You’ll Do Manage projects and perform analysis on technical assessments looking for evidence of compromise and/or security misconfigurations in Azure, M365, AWS, or GCP Produce high-quality written and verbal reports, presentations, recommendations, and findings to key stakeholders including customer management, regulators, and legal counsel. Demonstrate industry thought leadership through blog posts, CrowdCasts, and other public speaking events. What You’ll Need Successful candidates will have experience in one or more of the following areas: Security technical assessments / controls review: hands-on experience reviewing security configurations including both using existing assessment tools and occasionally scripting your own Communications: strong ability to communicate executive and/or detailed level findings to clients; ability to effectively communicate tasks, guidance, and methodology with internal teams Experience/training in the topics below is beneficial but not essential for consideration: Cloud Operations: familiarity with modern cloud workloads - DevOps, CICD pipelines, containers, and related security defenses and pitfalls. Cloud Incident Response: knowledge in AWS, Azure, M365, or GCP incident response methodologies. Vulnerability Management: experience prioritizing risks to provide customers with actionable advice to improve their security posture. Incident Remediation: strong understanding of targeted attacks and able to create customized tactical and strategic remediation plans for compromised organizations related to major cloud platforms. Additionally, All Candidates Must Possess The Following Qualifications Capable of completing technical tasks without supervision. Desire to grow and expand both technical and soft skills. Strong project management skills. Contributing thought leader within the cloud security/incident response industry. Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude. Education BA or BS / MA or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Information Security, Information Assurance, Information Security Management, Intelligence Studies, Cybersecurity, Cybersecurity Policy, or a related field. Applicants without a degree but with relevant work experience and/or training will be considered. Certifications Holders of a CISSP, CISA, CISM, CCSP, or any practitioner or security certifications in AWS, Azure and GCP may be considered in lieu of or in addition to a degree. This role may require the candidate to periodically undergo and pass alcohol and/or drug test(s) during the course of employment. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve. CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The salary range for this position in the U.S. is $105,000 - $155,000 per year + bonus + equity + benefits. #WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight. About The Role CrowdStrike is looking for highly motivated, self-driven, technical consultants dedicated to making a difference in global security by protecting organizations against the most advanced attackers in the world. Our CrowdStrike Services team offers opportunities to expand your skill set through a wide variety of engagements including front page incident response investigations for organizations you’ll find on the annual Fortune 100 list. Am I a Consultant/Senior Consultant Candidate? Do you find yourself interested in and keeping up with the latest vulnerabilities and breaches? Are you self-motivated and looking for an opportunity to rapidly accelerate your skills? Do you crave new and innovative work that actually matters to your customer? Do you have a Network Monitoring, Incident Response, or Information Security background that you’re not fully utilizing? Are you capable of operating as an individual contributor and occasionally leading teams and interacting with customers? Do you love working around like-minded, smart people who you can learn from and mentor on a daily basis? Typical Responsibilities Manage projects or perform forensic analysis on incident response engagements involving network monitoring data. Manage projects or perform analysis on technical assessments looking for indicators of compromise or security misconfigurations in network monitoring data. Produce high-quality written and verbal reports, presentations, recommendations, and findings to key stakeholders including customer management, regulators, and legal counsel. Demonstrate industry thought leadership through blog posts, CrowdCasts, and other public speaking events. Required Qualifications Successful candidates will have experience in one or more of the following areas: Monitoring of intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS or IPS) to detect the occurrence of intrusions, malicious software, or other unauthorized activity. Network traffic analysis (PCAP analysis) for purposes of identifying intrusions, malicious software, or other unauthorized activity. Incident Response: experience supporting or managing incident response investigations for organizations, investigating targeted threats such as the Advanced Persistent Threat, Organized Crime, and Hacktivists. Security Assessments: experience supporting or managing security assessments focused on determining the presence or absence of malicious activity operating on the subject system(s). In-depth knowledge of intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS or IPS): a background using a variety of network traffic analysis tools including Zeek, Suricata, Snort, Corelight, Fidelis, Security Onion, and similar. Communications: strong ability to communicate executive and/or detailed level findings to clients; ability to effectively communicate tasks, guidance, and methodology with internal teams Additionally, All Candidates Must Possess The Following Qualifications Capable of completing technical tasks without supervision. Desire to grow and expand both technical and soft skills. Strong project management skills. Contributing thought leader within the cybersecurity industry. Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude. Education BA or BS / MA or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Information Security, Information Assurance, Information Security Management, Intelligence Studies, Cybersecurity, Cybersecurity Policy, or a related field is desirable. Applicants without a degree but with relevant work experience and/or training will be considered. This role may require the candidate to periodically undergo and pass alcohol and/or drug test(s) during the course of employment. #WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight. About The Role CrowdStrike is seeking a Corporate Account Executive to sell into our Midmarket segment. They will partner with our Sales Development, Sales Engineering, Channel Account Managers, and Marketing team to effectively break down barriers and showcase the value of our products. If you are a hunter, who enjoys the thrill of closing net new opportunities, then this is the role for you! This role is 100% remote in the following cities: Austin TX, Dallas, TX, Houston, TX, Sunnyvale CA, San Francisco CA, Los Angeles CA, Orange County CA, San Diego CA, Denver, CO, Phoenix AZ, Raleigh NC, Chicago IL, and Boston, MA. Surrounding locations with a reasonable commute to the cities listed will be considered. What You’ll Do Run a full sales process from prospecting to close. Strategize with our channel partners to drive net-new business. Forecast and report updates to management team through Clari. Become an insider within the cyber security industry and become an expert of CrowdStrike’s platform. Stay well educated and informed about CrowdStrike’s competitive landscape and how to sell the value of our solutions and services when compared to the relevant competitors in the Next-Generation Endpoint Protection Platform marketspace. May require modified work hours to accommodate accounts in other time zones, and minimal, but occasional travel for accounts that require a higher touch to achieve closure. What You'll Need 1+ years of full sales cycle experience, generating net new business for a SaaS, Cloud, and/or Security solution. 1+ years of experience carrying a dedicated sales quota, with responsibility for full sales cycle from sourcing to closing. Experience with a consultative sales process with proven ability to sell a broad, multi-module solution to mid/enterprise organizations. Confidence to sell into C-level Executives and/or Evaluator-level Security and IT Leadership. Ability to execute a go-to-market strategy and prospect into accounts using SFDC, Outreach, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, cold calling, emailing, and more. Previous experience strategizing with Channel Partners which may include, but not be limited to, Value-Added-Resellers and Managed Service Providers Track record of exceeding expectations in an individually focused, quota carrying role. Technical aptitude and ability to learn new business and technical concepts quickly. Competitive nature, but also a collaborative team player. Strong presentation skills, both in person and via virtual channels. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve. CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

A go-getter that sets his/her sights above and beyond to blow out his/her established targets and quotas. Persistent – Doesn’t stop at “no”. Believes they can overcome. Coachable - Seeks help; knows how to get help, when to ask for it and what situations call for it. Charismatic - knows how to use it. Sharp/Quick Witted - thinks on his/her feet. Flexibility to handle a curveball. Creative – Can think outside the box (when appropriate). Motivated - to learn, to succeed, to win, to grow. Aptitude - Able to learn and implement new concepts quickly. Confidence with absence of Ego. Self-Disciplined - Proven to be good at time management, organization, and demonstrate discipline in their process and everyday business. Self-aware – Has a solid understanding of their strengths and weaknesses and what they need to work on. Fluent in Portuguese is a plus. If you are a hunter, who enjoys the thrill of closing net new opportunities, then this is the role for you! This role is 100% remote in the following cities: Austin TX, Dallas, TX, Houston, TX, Sunnyvale CA, San Francisco CA, Los Angeles CA, Orange County CA, San Diego CA, Denver, CO, Phoenix AZ, Raleigh NC, Chicago IL, and Boston, MA. Surrounding locations with a reasonable commute to the cities listed will be considered. What You’ll Do Run a full sales process from prospecting to close. Strategize with our channel partners to drive net-new business. Forecast and report updates to management team through Clari. Become an insider within the cyber security industry and become an expert of CrowdStrike’s platform. Stay well educated and informed about CrowdStrike’s competitive landscape and how to sell the value of our solutions and services when compared to the relevant competitors in the Next-Generation Endpoint Protection Platform marketspace. May require modified work hours to accommodate accounts in other time zones, and minimal, but occasional travel for accounts that require a higher touch to achieve closure. What You'll Need 1+ years of full sales cycle experience, generating net new business for a SaaS, Cloud, and/or Security solution. 1+ years of experience carrying a dedicated sales quota, with responsibility for full sales cycle from sourcing to closing. Experience with a consultative sales process with proven ability to sell a broad, multi-module solution to mid/enterprise organizations. Confidence to sell into C-level Executives and/or Evaluator-level Security and IT Leadership. Ability to execute a go-to-market strategy and prospect into accounts using SFDC, Outreach, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, cold calling, emailing, and more. Previous experience strategizing with Channel Partners which may include, but not be limited to, Value-Added-Resellers and Managed Service Providers Track record of exceeding expectations in an individually focused, quota carrying role. Technical aptitude and ability to learn new business and technical concepts quickly. Competitive nature, but also a collaborative team player. Strong presentation skills, both in person and via virtual channels. Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike Remote-first culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits Physical and mental wellness programs Paid parental leave, including adoption A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve. About The Role CrowdStrike’s Corporate Development team is growing and is looking to hire a Senior Associate focused on helping us build our M&A operations and maintain relationships with our portfolio companies inside the Falcon Fund. The primary focus of this role will be to help execute strategic M&A and drive key touch-points between Falcon Fund companies (both existing and prospective) across CrowdStrike to help us create and maintain value for both parties. This role will work closely with the VP of Corporate Development and the broader CTO Labs leadership team to help identify, prioritize, and evaluate relevant companies across both the M&A function and the Falcon Fund. We are looking for someone energetic with strong interpersonal and organizational skills that can work across a variety of functions both within and outside of CrowdStrike. This role will be reporting into our VP of Corporate Development and will spend considerable time working alongside other CrowdStrike functions, including our partnerships and alliances teams. What You’ll Need Bachelors degree (MBAs welcomed) with 2+ years of work experience Self-starter, ambitious, self-directed, resourceful, and able to dig into the details (analysis) is key Have an excellent, team-based attitude Demonstrate excellent communication skills (written and verbal) Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to positively interact and present with hiring managers and Executive Leadership Be experienced in the use of Microsoft office, specifically Excel and PowerPoint Excellent valuation/analytical skills and creativity in problem solving What You’ll Do The Corporate Development team plays a key role in helping to drive CrowdStrike’s strategy, focusing on both M&A as well as our rapidly growing investment arm, Falcon Fund. Falcon Fund in particular has expanded from a $20mn investment vehicle primarily focused on early-stage companies to a $100mn+ entity investing in companies across all stages of their evolution. Most recently, the fund has invested in a variety of high-profile stories, including Salt Security, Vanta, Talon, Dig, and JumpCloud. With more than a dozen investments, Falcon Fund represents one of the largest and fastest growing strategic corporate VC arms in cybersecurity. Bonus Points M&A experience in software, executing transaction (valuation, due diligence, managing working groups) Experience in alliances and relationship building both within an organization and externally Program management experience - the ability to see something through from vision through delivery Be calm under pressure with a demonstrated track record of successfully managing multiple projects simultaneously Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike Remote-first culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits Physical and mental wellness programs Paid parental leave, including adoption A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. About The Role The Data Engineer is responsible for building and maintaining the data foundations of the Sales, Specialist Sales, and Sales Engineering business units and automating and aggregating data from internal systems as well as external vendors and agencies. As a key member of the Go-To-Market Data, Forecasting, & Analytics team, the Data Engineer collaborates with Analysts and Sales leadership to create data models that power business intelligence and analytics across business planning, pipeline analysis, bookings forecast optimization, sales analytics, and lead source attribution. They are a self-driven individual with excellent analytical and problem solving skills, able to quickly comprehend and adapt to emerging priorities and thrive in a fast-paced, high-performing environment. In addition to managing the data foundation, the Data Engineer will work across IT, Sales Operations, Marketing Operations, and Finance to align on standardized processes, metrics, and architecture. They also will create and maintain documentation on all processes and datasets. What You’ll Do Design, develop, and maintain a data platform that serves as the foundation of the Sales, Specialist Sales, and Sales Engineering business units, automating and aggregating data from internal systems as well as external vendors Design, develop, build and maintain data models to deliver insightful analytics while ensuring the highest standard in data integrity Build data pipelines and reports that enable analysts and other stakeholders across the business unit Interface with engineers from other systems and applications to ensure proper data collection Ensure data quality by implementing data detection mechanisms Maintain and onboard new systems/vendors to enable data collection and analytics for the Sales business unit Participate in reviewing the data models created by the team and change the existing data models in production as necessary Educate your partners: use your data and analytics experience to “see what’s missing,” identifying and addressing gaps in their existing processes Support existing processes running in production and optimize when possible What You’ll Need 3+ years of experience as a Data / Analytics Engineer, ETL Developer, or similar functions at a fast-paced company, including designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems 3+ years of experience with production-level SQL, with the ability to write, analyze, and debug SQL queries 2+ years of experience with Python and Java preferred Experience with Salesforce and Snowflake preferred Experience with Domo and/or Tableau preferred Experience with Sales, Alliances, and/or Marketing a plus BS/MS in Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or related field Effective communication, at scale, through multiple media: presentations, dashboards, company-wide datasets, bots and more Demonstrated understanding of development processes and agile methodologies Intellectually curious and willing to learn Benefits Of Working At About The Role CrowdStrike is seeking an experienced Engineer to join our growing Advanced Detection Research (ADR) team. As a DevOps engineer you will be focused on automation, deployment and support of our detection solutions. You will be working with engineers, data scientists and security experts in researching innovative ways of identifying attacks, escalation points and compromise. Your day to day activities will be quite diverse and challenging, as you work with different subject matter experts in solving unique problems. If you are interested in working with a high performing team and curious on how detection problems are solved, this is the job for you! What You'll Do Work closely with the team to ensure efficient operation of daily activities, engineering productivity and continuous improvement of products and processes. Design automated solutions that leverage infrastructure and configuration management tools such as Jenkins, Kaniko, Terraform, Ansible, Chef, etc. Perform root cause analysis, troubleshoot and resolve production related issues. Tackle complex design problems across a wide variety of tool sets in the SDLC process. Document processes and procedures. What You'll Need 4+ years of production-level experience in building, delivering, supporting and maintaining systems at scale. Extensive development experience in creating end to end software CI/CD Pipelines Production working experience with Kubernetes or other container deployment technologies (AWS ECS, Nomad, Spinnaker, etc) Working experience in configuring observability & monitoring platforms such as Snyk, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack etc. Development experience with one of the following languages – Javascript, Scala, Python, Go or C++ Strong development experience writing pipeline code in Jenkins using Groovy, including shared libraries. Ability to read and write simple to moderately complex scripts and programs for automation, tools, frameworks, dashboards, alarms. (Common uses: Python, Groovy, Bash) Knowledge of proper monitoring, maintenance, and disaster recovery of critical services. Comfortable leading open-ended research-focused efforts, and developing them into a series of concrete deliverables. This role will require the candidate to periodically undergo and pass additional background and fingerprint check(s) consistent with government customer requirements. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight. About The Role CrowdStrike Information Technology is looking for a hands-on Director of Enterprise Collaboration to join our team. This position will be focused on our internal messaging and communications systems, collaborative software systems and operate as a people leader and solutions architect for the platforms. To succeed in this technical role, you must be a self-starter who functions well as part of a distributed IT team in a dynamic environment. You must be comfortable and confident in assessing competing interests and technical trade-offs while placing the success and integrity of the company’s objectives as the primary goal. In this role you will be responsible for multiple teams of dedicated engineers who design, implement and manage all facets of the CrowdStrike collaboration platforms and related technologies. You will be integral to successful communications among the rapidly growing team of CrowdStrikers who rely on your technology stacks. Additionally, you’ll be leading the team through a migration of on-prem messaging systems to fully cloud native solutions. You will challenge your group to deploy newer technologies which complement and extend capabilities. What You’ll Need Bachelor degree in Information Technology, a related field or equivalent work experience Minimum 10+ years hands-on deployment, administration and troubleshooting experience in mid to large scale enterprise Minimum 5+ years in a leadership role directly supervising a messaging and/or collaboration platform team Demonstrated experience with hybrid and cloud native messaging solutions Experience managing Slack, Atlassian Qualtrics and sentiment analysis Experience deploying and managing Google Workspace environments Ability to analyze issues and provide clear, effective, solutions with minimal interruption to business flow Excellent written and verbal communication skills Bonus Points Architecture, design and administration knowledge with Microsoft Exchange 2019 Demonstrated experience with e-discovery and archival technologies Experience with large-scale messaging platform migration Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike Remote-first culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits Physical and mental wellness programs Paid parental leave, including adoption A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve. CrowdStrike is committed to maintaining an environment of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action. If you need reasonable accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Recruiting@crowdstrike.com , for further assistance. CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The salary range for this position in the U.S. is $165,000 - $240,000 per year + bonus + equity + benefits. A candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location. CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program. Notice of E-Verify Participation Right to Work

Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight. About The Role We are looking for a Sr. Director of Technical and Competitive Marketing to lead our team of talented technical marketing engineers (TMEs) and competitive marketers to drive business growth with highly a strategic plan and execution across all technical and competitive and late-stage content needs, including highly differentiated demos, hands-on-workshops (including ownership of the overall platform), and other key technical & competitive content (blogs, whitepapers, webinars, podcasts, battlecards, comparison pages, internal technical enablement etc.). This strategic role will work with our product management, business development, marketing, and sales teams to bring exciting new innovations to market and drive value to our customers, as well as serving as a technical evangelist for our platform. You will work with the best in the business, and we need you to bring your creativity, imagination and energy to this high-profile position. We also need you to have strong knowledge of observability and log management technologies to be really successful in this role, that acts as a bridge across our various product portfolios. This Sr. Director of Technical & Competitive Marketing will be required to ensure that the technical differentiation, ease of use, and understanding for key portfolios and products is articulated well for CrowdStrike customers and prospects. This position is more than just educating on technical content or helping to validate technical ideas. The right candidate will be strategic, proactive, self-driven, and inspire people to think differently about how they approach, buy, and manage cybersecurity products across the holistic CrowdStrike Falcon Platform. An ideal candidate will have experience across multiple categories, including EDR/XDR, CNAPP, DevOps, IT Ops and security knowledge and experience, excellent communication skills, creativity, and a passion for teaching others about technology. Additional Responsibilities Develop an end-to-end technical content & competitive strategy aligned with overall company goals. Design, develop, and distribute content and resources such as presentations, demonstrations, demos, reference materials, battle cards, product comparisons and other technical and competitive marketing documentation. Collaborate with other marketing, competitive intelligence, engineering, product, and leadership resources to build highly scalable and compelling content and demos. Understand market trends, needs of the sales team and regional competitive influences to develop highly desirable content for CrowdStrike’s prospective customers. Serve as a senior technical resource and evangelist for the overall marketing and sales team. What You’ll Need Bachelor Degree or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or relevant work experience. 10+ years or equivalent experience in consulting, support, sales engineering, technical training, or technical marketing Strong leadership skills with the ability to work independently while also managing expectations of customers and Senior Management Enterprise security domain experience a must Technical background with ability to get hands-on with the product Experience working with global teams on multiple projects and programs Strong relationship management and team skills, flexible, attentive to detail and quality Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficiency in technology demonstration techniques (i.e. live demo, presentations, screencasts, webinars, etc.) Experience in tracking and analyzing market trends, competitive positioning and marketing programs Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike Remote-first culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits Physical and mental wellness programs Paid parental leave, including adoption A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. jobTitle: DOD SkillBridge Intern, Public Sector Industry Business Unit
jobDescription: #WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight. About The Role CrowdStrike is proud to be an authorised provider of the DoD SkillBridge program which provides opportunity for US Service Members to gain valuable civilian work experience through specific industry training and internships. Under the SkillBridge Program, CrowdStrike hosts active-duty U.S. military members for skilled employment training for up to the final six months of active-duty obligated service. CrowdStrike is looking for highly motivated, self-driven, senior executive strategist and advisor dedicated to making a difference in global security by protecting organizations against the most advanced attackers in the world. Our CrowdStrike Public Sector Industry Business Unit offers opportunities to expand your skill set through a wide variety of experiences, interaction with teams across the organization; product, legal, marketing, sales, etc. as well as engagements with current and potential clients. The position also enables the transitioning service member to develop the quarterly and annual strategy that will drive our contribution to global security and client support. This position is open to candidates within the Continental United States, Hawaii, Alaska and Puerto Rico. Am I an Executive Strategist and Cyber Advisor? Are you passionate about cyber security and protecting our vital national interests, communities and businesses? Are you self-motivated and looking for an opportunity to rapidly accelerate your skills and experience through life-long learning, engaged discussions and cyber strategy development? Do you crave new and innovative work that actually matters to clients? Do you have experience leading security teams across the Department of Defense and Federal Government? Are you capable of articulating complex problems through easy-to-understand solutions drawing upon your experience in uniform? Do you love working around like-minded, smart people who you can learn from and mentor on a daily basis? Job Description And Responsibilities This role requires practitioner leadership knowledge to serve CrowdStrike customers and prospects in an Executive Strategist and cyber advisor role, jointly discussion strategic planning initiatives, the current threat landscape, and proactive initiatives to stay ahead of the adversary. Establish and maintain active relationships with key customers and industry decision makers across the U.S. Department of Defense and Federal government, providing cybersecurity modernizations capabilities and approaches that are proven. Typical Daily Responsibilities Advising the company and sales teams on the most effective implementation of security platforms. Coaching, training and mentoring across the organization with humility and compassion. Developing strategic engagement plans with sales teams. Interacting with various portions of the organization to gain an understanding and appreciation for business outcomes, strategic plans, corporate initiatives and leadership in a civilian setting. Produce high-quality written and verbal communications, recommendations, and findings both internal to CrowdStrike and external to our current clients and future prospects. Demonstrate industry thought leadership through blog posts, articles, CrowdCasts, and other public speaking events. What You'll Need Qualifications, Experience and Skills Successful candidates will have experience in one or more of the following areas: Leadership: current of prior CISO and/or CIO in the DoD with authority and responsibility of securing critical and/or national security networks and computer environments. Technical Competency: a deep understanding of security controls, capabilities, technologies and procedures. Mus have an aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems and an ability to explain complicated concepts to a variety of audiences and skill levels. Problem Solving Skills: an ability to analyze complex multivariate problems and use a systematic approach to gain swift resolution. Desire to Learn and Grow: a strong desire to listen, learn and grow while providing recommendations and input based on your background and experience as a cybersecurity leaders. Additionally, All Candidates Must Possess The Following Qualifications Current or former CISO / CIO experience in the DoD. Desire to grow and expand both technical and soft skills. Strong project management skills. Contributing thought leader within the incident response industry. Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude. Requirements Meets DoD SkillBridge Qualifications. Current Active Duty Service Member. Available to participate 90-180 days. Must be willing to work on site. Offering a hybrid model which allows for some remote days each week after training. This role is only open to US citizens. Education BA or BS / MA or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Information Security, Information Assurance, Information Security Management, Intelligence Studies, Cybersecurity, Cybersecurity Policy, or a related field. We will consider all applications with relevant technical and/or leadership experience. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve. CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

jobTitle: Executive Assistant to the CEO (West Coast Remote)
jobDescription: #WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight. About The Role We are looking for a sharp, experienced operational professional who enjoys solving complex problems and is motivated by flawless execution. This role requires an independent self-starter who serves as an ambassador to our most senior executives, demonstrates sound judgment, and establishes a foundation of loyalty through behaviors that inspire trust. The ideal candidate understands the importance of confidentiality and discretion while simultaneously communicating context to stakeholders; empowering them to make informed decisions, solve problems, and reduce information churn. We are looking for someone who naturally operates with a customer service mindset enabling them to partner with a broad range of personalities and adapt to unique traits and working styles. CrowdStrike is a fast moving business in a dynamic industry where the ability to work with confidential information is of the utmost importance. Successful administrative candidates have a demonstrated ability to effortlessly adapt to change and display grace and confidence under pressure. Operational Responsibilities Ensure executive’s time is aligned with their priorities through demonstrated understanding of the core business and by leveraging strategic prioritization strategies. Build relationships and trust with key stakeholders. May act as the executive’s proxy to increase capacity and allow the executive to focus on strategic priorities. Increase bandwidth and productivity by anticipating needs and taking ownership of planning, executing, and delegating activities which create an extra layer of accountability. Maximize efficiency and communication by building out systems and processes for increased organization and unified work-streams. Provide complex and dynamic scheduling and calendar support for the executive. Advance preparation for all commitments and engagements, including comprehensive briefing materials and pre-reads, meeting agendas, presentations, itineraries etc. Review all materials for accuracy and completeness, push-back on stakeholders if documentation is not comprehensive. Accountable for planning, coordination and oversight of domestic and international aviation, both commercial and private. Acute attention to detail, continuously checking and rechecking all reservations and logistics for accuracy. Must have significant experience with private aviation and documentation required for global travel. Process travel and other expense reimbursements on a timely basis. Frequent travel is required to support senior executive(s) at industry conferences, keynotes, internal meetings and events. Strategic Responsibilities Coordinate with stakeholders in executive business units and serve as the first line of defense for new and recurring executive requests. Draft initial and reactive email communications to streamline and prioritize executive time; serve as the single point of contact for subsequent communications after initial contact with the executive. Deconflict executive requests to align with the mission and priorities of the business, the corporate calendar, and the sales cycle prior to presenting to executive for approval. Execute and set the strategic direction for the corporate calendar. Regularly communicate with stakeholders across the business to ensure alignment. Communicate changes with empathy and respect, understanding that small changes have significant impact to downstream operations. Vet, research, and prepare materials with internal business units (marketing, sales, finance, product, engineering, etc.) for all executive speaking engagements and critical meetings. Maintain extensive knowledge of current geopolitical and security industry activities. Actively participate and communicate with a team of executive assistants to maintain cross-functional alignment, standardize process and procedure, and ensure operational efficiency and effectiveness. Requirements Prioritization and problem solving. Your sound problem solving approach and ability to prioritize makes you an expert at bringing order to chaos and navigating uncertainty with speed and confidence; you look around corners to identify and solve problems before they arise, and are able to find solutions that balance the personal needs of the executive with the needs of the business. Polished executive presence. You have high EQ and executive presence with a natural ability to build and maintain relationships across all levels of the organization. You tactfully negotiate complex business situations with sensitivity and discretion, effectively manage intricate projects and partnerships, and are a precise, polished, and well spoken representative of the executive and the business. Ownership and partnership. You’re an expert at viewing the bigger, strategic picture to help anticipate needs and identify priorities. You’re able to draw on previous experience to create systems that streamline operations in service of a unified goal. As you prioritize executive time, you ensure the details never slip through the cracks. Expert communication. You effectively drive alignment and understanding across stakeholders through efficient communication that reduces ambiguity and information churn for both yourself and others. You understand the importance of both method and timing in communications, and you skillfully adapt your style to match context and meet the unique needs of your audience. You demonstrate excellent writing, editing, grammatical, and research skills. Integrity and discretion. You uphold the highest standards of integrity in all that you do. You build sincere relationships based on trust and respect, and show compassion and empathy in all interactions. You display professional discretion and honor the confidence of those that entrust you with information in an effort to assist with solving problems. You use strong judgment when those discussions need to be escalated to ensure the safety and protection of the colleagues or clients involved. Qualifications 8+ years experience providing executive support to CEO or equivalent 4+ years experience supporting an senior executive at a Fortune 500 company preferred Bachelor's degree from an accredited university Previous management experience Experience with handling executive(s) private aviation / FBO needs such as planning, coordination and oversight of domestic and international aviation (commercial and private) Extremely proficient with Microsoft Office Suite with high aptitude for learning new software and systems Diverse background including experience in project/program management Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike Remote-first culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits Physical and mental wellness programs Paid parental leave, including adoption A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted i
